posts.title: Scout Raihan & Duraludon and Tackle Pokémon Masters EX’s New Time Trial Event
posts.author: Admin
posts.content:
The Galar region sync pair can help players earn useful items by completing battles quickly in the Eternal Rivals time trial event.

As you’ve played Pokémon Masters EX, you’ve undoubtedly worked on developing your sync pairs’ power and on choosing the most effective attacks during battle, but have you been focusing on your reaction time? The game’s latest time trial event has just begun, and fortunately, a new Galar region sync pair has arrived to help.

You can now scout Raihan & Duraludon in the sync pair scout until May 30, 2021, at 10:59 p.m. PDT. As the featured sync pair for the Eternal Rivals time trial event, they get a valuable boost if you take them into an event battle. Raihan & Duraludon’s stats will be doubled (except for HP), and you’ll earn twice as many points when you complete a battle with them.

The time trial event Eternal Rivals runs from April 27, 2021, at 11:00 p.m. PDT to May 15, 2021, at 10:59 p.m. PDT. As you play the event, you’ll receive points based on how quickly you complete the event battles. You can then obtain a variety of different items depending on your total points, such as 5★ Power-Ups, 5★ Scout Tickets, strike move candy coins, tech move candy coins, and more.

Just make sure you’re prepared before heading into battle. You can attempt this event only three times each day, but any unused attempts will carry over to the next day. You can also hone your skills in a practice match, which lets you refine your strategies without using up stamina or your limited number of attempts.

To give yourself a little edge in battle, lower the battle speed to make it easier to queue up attacks with all your sync pairs. Remember, every second counts in time trial events, so don’t waste a moment!

Pokémon Masters EX is available to download now, so don’t miss out on all the fun! For more details, be sure to visit the Pokémon Masters EX official site.

posts.desc: Show your power with Single Strike and Rapid Strike cards in the new Pokémon TCG expansion, Sword & Shield—Battle Styles. Available now!

posts.title: Deck Strategy: Victini VMAX from Sword & Shield—Battle Styles
posts.author: Admin
posts.content: While the new Sword & Shield—Battle Styles expansion puts a lot of focus on the new Rapid Strike and Single Strike cards, it would be a mistake for any player to ignore the rest of the set.
posts.desc: Show your power with Single Strike and Rapid Strike cards in the new Pokémon TCG expansion, Sword & Shield—Battle Styles. Available now!

posts.title: Rivals’ Week Introduces Therian Forme Landorus, Skrelp, and Clauncher to Pokémon GO
posts.author: Admin
posts.content:
Channel your competitive side from April 13 to April 18 with an event featuring Pokémon known to be rivals.

From Tuesday, April 13, 2021, at 10:00 a.m. to Sunday, April 18, 2021, at 8:00 p.m. local time, you can celebrate the spirit of competition in Pokémon GO with Rivals’ Week. Therian Forme Landorus, Skrelp, and Clauncher will all make their Pokémon GO debuts, so the event will give you a great opportunity to fill out your Pokédex. Skrelp and Clauncher will be appearing in the wild, in raids, and in encounters following research tasks, and Therian Forme Landorus will be appearing in five-star raids.

By working with your fellow Trainers to win Raid Battles in the Global Challenge Arena, you can unlock event-exclusive rewards. You can also challenge Team GO Rocket, whose minions will be appearing more frequently at PokéStops and in balloons throughout the event. Plus, you can complete event-exclusive Field Research tasks that lead to encounters with certain Pokémon.

Pokémon that are known for their competitive spirit—like Hitmonlee, Hitmonchan, Makuhita, Meditite, Zangoose, Seviper, and more—will be appearing more frequently in the wild. The theme of competition will also extend to raids, where Pokémon like Nidoqueen, Nidoking, Zangoose, Seviper, Therian Forme Landorus, Skrelp, Clauncher, and more will be appearing.

The following Pokémon will be hatching from 5 km Eggs during the event: Machop, Tyrogue, Elekid, Magby, Makuhita, Meditite, Zangoose, and Seviper.

Rival up!
posts.desc: Show your power with Single Strike and Rapid Strike cards in the new Pokémon TCG expansion, Sword & Shield—Battle Styles. Available now!

posts.title: Watch Misty’s Memorable Moments in Pokémon the Series on Pokémon TV
posts.author: Admin
posts.content:
The Cerulean Gym Leader shows her competitive side and love for Water-type Pokémon.

Misty is one of the most enduring characters in Pokémon the Series, having debuted in the very first episode. Since her momentous first meeting with Ash and Pikachu, Misty worked hard to establish herself as a powerful Water-type Pokémon Trainer. Though she has a reputation for appreciating cute Pokémon, Misty is also a loud and proud advocate for all Water-type Pokémon. The Gym Leader is fiercely competitive in Pokémon battles, and she prides herself on making Trainers work hard to earn her Gym’s Cascade Badge.

You’ve got two weeks to watch the curated collection of Misty’s memorable moments sharing her love of Water-type Pokémon in classic episodes on Pokémon TV. Remember that you can watch Pokémon TV here on watch.pokemon.com or using the Pokémon TV mobile app.
posts.desc: Show your power with Single Strike and Rapid Strike cards in the new Pokémon TCG expansion, Sword & Shield—Battle Styles. Available now!

posts.title: Celebrate World Penguin Day with Max Raid Battles Featuring Eiscue
posts.author: Admin
posts.content:
Through April 25, the Penguin Pokémon Eiscue will be appearing more frequently in Max Raid Battles.

World Penguin Day is April 25, and there’s no better way to celebrate the adorable flightless bird in Pokémon Sword and Pokémon Shield than with Max Raid battles featuring Eiscue, the Penguin Pokémon! Eiscue will be appearing more frequently in Max Raid Battles through April 25 at 4:59 p.m. PDT. Lucky Trainers might even encounter a Shiny one, which has a pastel pink ice cube on its head.

To encounter Eiscue in Max Raid Battles, you’ll need to connect your Nintendo Switch system to the internet. Then, whenever you see a pillar of light shining from a Pokémon Den in the Wild Area or elsewhere, walk up to the Pokémon Den and interact with it to start a Max Raid Battle with a Dynamax Pokémon. This event does not affect the Pokémon encountered within Dynamax Adventures.

Happy World Penguin Day!
posts.desc: Show your power with Single Strike and Rapid Strike cards in the new Pokémon TCG expansion, Sword & Shield—Battle Styles. Available now!

posts.title: Get Ready for Pokémon GO Fest 2021 on July 17 and 18
posts.author: Admin
posts.content:
Mark your calendars for two days of catching and researching Pokémon during this global event!

Pokémon GO‘s biggest event of the year is fast approaching! Starting on Saturday, July 17, 2021, and running through Sunday, July 18, 2021, Pokémon GO Fest 2021 will offer exciting opportunities for Trainers around the world to complete research, catch Pokémon, and more. Additional details will be revealed in the coming weeks, so stay tuned.

And of course—don’t forget to get hyped!
posts.desc: Show your power with Single Strike and Rapid Strike cards in the new Pokémon TCG expansion, Sword & Shield—Battle Styles. Available now!

posts.title: Celebrate New Pokémon Snap with a Focus on Photography on Pokémon TV
posts.author: Admin
posts.content:
Watch your favorite Pokémon photographers shoot their way to success for a limited time.

Commemorate the launch of New Pokémon Snap by watching the Pokémon world’s most talented photographers in action. Kanto photographer Todd Snap has a talent for photographing rare Pokémon, while Santalune City Gym Leader Viola discovers artistry in Gym battles and photographing Pokémon alike. Watch as these and other iconic Pokémon photographers shoot to win in stunningly picturesque episodes of Pokémon the Series.

You’ll have two weeks to watch the exciting collection focusing on Pokémon photographers in classic episodes. Remember that you can watch Pokémon TV on watch.pokemon.com or using the Pokémon TV mobile app.
posts.desc: Show your power with Single Strike and Rapid Strike cards in the new Pokémon TCG expansion, Sword & Shield—Battle Styles. Available now!

posts.title: Master Charged Attacks and Fast Attacks in the GO Battle League
posts.author: Admin
posts.content:
Master Charged Attacks and Fast Attacks in the GO Battle League

Pokémon battles require skill, knowledge, and experience to master. Pokémon GO gives Trainers of all levels the opportunity to master Pokémon battling through the GO Battle League, and there’s plenty of incentive to climb the ranks—including earning rewards such as Rare Candies and Stardust along the way. If you’re just getting started with Trainer Battles in Pokémon GO, there’s a lot to learn—and even more advanced Trainers can benefit from tips, advice, and strategies, too.

posts.title: Pokémon: Diamond and Pearl Episodes Added to Pokémon TV
posts.author: Admin
posts.content:
Journey with Ash and Pikachu as they make new friends and face new challenges in the Sinnoh region.

Ash and Pikachu’s journey takes them to the Sinnoh region as Pokémon: Diamond and Pearl arrives on Pokémon TV this Friday. This 10th season of Pokémon the Series sees our heroes reuniting with their longtime companion Brock and making a new friend in Dawn, a novice Pokémon Coordinator hoping to follow in her mother’s footsteps. Together, they set out to accomplish their dreams while taking on new battles, facing new rivals, and meeting Pokémon like Turtwig, Chimchar, and Piplup. Of course, Team Rocket will be there to cause more trouble, but could the mysterious Team Galactic prove to be a bigger threat?

When you tune in to watch Pokémon: Diamond and Pearl, remember to load up the Pokémon TV mobile app and enjoy these classic episodes on the go!
posts.desc: Show your power with Single Strike and Rapid Strike cards in the new Pokémon TCG expansion, Sword & Shield—Battle Styles. Available now!
